snippet: Feisty shareholders at companies like Publicis and its bigger rival in London, the WPP Group, are increasingly seeking to curb executive pay through more direct methods than taxation.
abstract: Feisty shareholders at European companies like Publicis and its bigger rival in London, the WPP Group, are increasingly seeking to curb advertising executive pay through more direct methods than taxation; some chiefs have accepted pay cuts or resigned in response to the scrutiny, but others have not.
lead_paragraph: Feisty shareholders at companies like Publicis and its bigger rival in London, the WPP Group, are increasingly seeking to curb executive pay through more direct methods than taxation.

headline.seo: Amid a ‘Shareholder Spring,’ Alarms Raised Over Executive Pay
headline.main: In Europe, a ‘Shareholder Spring’ Leads to a Push to Curb Ad Executives’ Pay
